intro: Potentilla fragariastrum breviscapa, commonly known as the short-stalked cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has serrated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
